page.title: 16Energy
page.content: In the Dalmeny Estate,just off the shore near Hound Point,is a new man_made island,an oil_tanker terminal.This is the last stage in the journey of crude oil from well to customer. The oil comes from the North Sea,in the Forties Field,one hundred miles ENE of Aberdeen.It comes in a pipeline 236 miles long to Grangemouth.Here it is treated and the gas is taken out of the crude oil.Some oil is kept and refined at Grangemouth.The rest is taken in a pipeline to a tank farm, looked after by British Petroleum,at Dalmeny.It is then pumped out to the terminal and into the ship.
